documents.document: @JJMSports what odds he stops whining and goes out and gets a proper job like the rest of us?
Would imagine @suttonunited will be moderately pleased with that draw!
@shugiehughie Worth reading @kinneston blog as Nick did have a positive for it. Must admit I trusted the form book instead of the blog!
@shugiehughie on the other hand take out its last race and it hadn't been beaten more than 5.25 lengths over jumps. Recency bias?
@ACMold Certainly showing more interest than Reading did!
Either #Chelsea or #ManUtd to win #FACup , at least they look interested unlike some of the others.
This may be a below strength #LeedsUnited, but if they get any injuries they are stuffed if this is the best the replacements can manage!
@MillieBroon Always does! Metophorically 'smacked me in the face' when I first saw him @KelsoRacecourse and always has since!
#KnockaraBeau still trying his best even at 14. Hope a nice little race can be found for him @KelsoRacecourse close out his career
With all respect to #Skybet, it's the Great Yorkshire Chase #RetainProperRaceNames
Good ride in defeat by Kielan Woods on the gutsy Midnight Jazz.
Cracking ride by #FelixDeGiles who would have been round a few X-Country courses on the continent.
Had real thrill watching from course centre as #ManyClouds zoomed round @KelsoRacecourse last March. RIP and thanks for the memories.
Pace a no brainer, Smad Place surely?
@BetVictorRacing @DavidPipeRacing @WetherbyRaces @tommyscu Wouldn't mind seeing that one if it goes over fences!
Presenting #AlternativeFacts - Isn't that a tactic that politicians have used since politics came into being?
@ursusocculta That's getting into Darwinian Selection territory!
#StillOpenAllHours just doesn't work! Open All Hours was Ronnie Barker and it hasn't worked moving forward without him.
I don't watch much skiing, but well done to @daveryding on a superb 2nd place in the Kitzbuhel World Cup slalom! Hard graft rewarded.
@BetVictorRacing @jackkennedy15 is a real right place, right time rider.
@theracingforum In the better races concentrate on lightly raced horses. In poor races such as Cl5 hcap chases, miles on clock seem better.
@theracingforum The problem there is that these days if they've done it before the market is smart and allows for it.
@JJMSports Backed 2 in a race at Fontwell once, first one fell at the 2nd, got up, ran loose and took out the other at the 4th fence!
@JJMSports and one falls and brings down the other!
@JJMSports Hope so, got Definitly Red in @theracingforum 10TF, need this one to follow up Waiting Patiently!
No Colin the proof of the pudding IS IN THE EATING!
@Harry05Derham @HAYDOCKRACES Good, and we appreciate you taking the time to let us know!
@Narrowthefield Whatever, he's just bagged 42 grand in a Grade 2. Wish I owned him!
#TheNewOne is a great one to bet on, because it looks hard work but he gets it done.
Well done @Braveheart_Alex on Deepsand for @lucindavrussell This lad is a decent young rider.
@steeplechasing He tanked away from them down the straight off a pretty decent pace.
Impressive by #NeonWolf and I get impression he'll be even better stepped up in distance.
Luke Morris didn't do much wrong there but Chevallier is frustrating
@itvracing @ITV4 and race times delayed by 5 minutes I understand, so your first at 1.35.
@auntiejackie_ @flyfromsadness @RevolutionUK @JackChevell and sticky out knees!
@McRaces On which basis it would be hard to see them getting permission to build on the whole site. Aim for the stars, reach the moon?
@McRaces One option would be developing the old Jubilee course/sprint spur area, largely untouched recently. Are the JC angling for that??
@McRaces I believe Ascot would keep more of the the King George feel. Conversely, my wife thinks Sandown is where it's at, loves the place!
@McRaces @Sandownpark @talkSPORT2 I think the phrase is "Yes, but he would, wouldn't he?" !
@Tom_Seagul @Narrowthefield No, Kelso is in Scotland, would have been the scotch pie wagon...
Nice to meet up with @BetVictorRacing along with @theracingforum at Kelso this afternoon. Believe me Jack, that wasn't cold for Kelso!
@Narrowthefield Think he realised he'd lost because he'd picked the wrong gap after the last. Should have gone between the other two.
Soft, Heavy in places at Kelso looks about right to me. Some gooey spots but generally not too bad.
Well done @lucindavrussell with One for Arthur! A cracking performance in a really competitive staying chase.
@CommentatorMark A tactic to press for redevelopment on the old Jubilee Course land?
@BradfieldCC @SandhurstCC @BerksCricket Yes, duly noted and #Mickeytakingmaterial lodged away for future reference!
Well done @MCYeeehaaa at Sandown yesterday, made some bookies look very uncomfortable about each-way terms. Keep the pressure on!
@shugiehughie Yes, it will be snowing the week the SPL starts up again!
Catching up with earlier race replays, nice to see #Catchamat and #CathyWalton stick it up the southern hot pot in Newcastle opener!
Looked a good ride by #DavidBass on #MaestroRoyal as his mount didn't look totally straight forward, odd head carriage.
Sound decision to retire #Dynaste Owes nothing to connections and here's to a long and happy retirement for the old boy!
@shugiehughie Kelso bumpers are always worth a glance I've spotted some good jumpers from those.
@TillyrieStables Well done Amy, the penny has finely dropped and he's doing you proud!
@shugiehughie You have to identify the genuine jumping types from bumpers. Decent types come through but they need to have scope.
A bit disappointing from Reading at Man Utd, gave it away early. I expected a bit better.
@shugiehughie Be interesting to see what happens after that one, they're an exposed sextet hardly likely to make huge forward leaps
@shugiehughie pound drops mean f*** all. Drops to enable entry to a lower grade, now that makes a difference!
@shugiehughie It's the system. if you lose it pays to be stuffed out of sight rather than 2nd or 3rd.
Any questions about strength of female jockeys knocked on the head by Lizzie Kelly who threw the kitchen sink at that one #Agrapart
@shugiehughie @Jamesracing1 Problem being assumption is made that 2nd has run to form. The concept of crap race doesn't register with BHA!
@shugiehughie Yes but nice to see Cogry back to form after a dicky spell over fences, he really battled hard.
@shugiehughie I did wonder if he had gone up too far. The Ayr race was a bit of an 'egg and spoon' race.
Well done Tour Des Champs, all guts and determination to hold on. 2 wins from first 7 runners for #SamDrinkwater
@shugiehughie Certainly seemed more soft ground horse conditions when walking the course and I note they added 'soft in places' after race 1
IMO Kelso going is on softish side of good to soft
All in a heap in the Lexus, nothing to worry Thistlecrack there.
Watch out for NOBLE INN, down the field Leopardstown 12.50 but never in a position to put in a challenge. Suspect much better in the locker.
Decent entry for @KelsoRacecourse tomorrow with double figure fields for all bar one event.
@tdthurgood Ryanair for Cue Card maybe?
That Word Search thing on @Channel4! What a racket! Â£3.60 plus a bit for a raffle ticket...
That may put Native River in as stable second string for the Gold Cup. Some performance!
The runner up at Chepstow, EVENING HUSH, looks more a good ground, sharper course type. Aintree maybe?
Nice job done by the Drinkwaters with #WorkingTitle in the first at @SedgefieldRace . Nice placement!
100/1 Gray Wolf River. Not exactly taking any chances there are you bookmakers? Add a nought?
@Punting4aLiving Thankfully the horse was OK, but jockey really lost the plot after 2 out. What was the flailing of the whip in aid of?
2 plus 2 equals 5 says @realDonaldTrump ! People voted for this man!
@DaveSoper1959 Quite right! Worst places to pass these days are the doorsteps of public buildings.
Sad to hear of the passing of Ade Keep of @mortimervillage . Knew him for years through cricket and a genuinely nice bloke.
@shugiehughie Hope not, I've got Big River in a Horses To Follow comp! However I fear automatons that pass for h'cappers might just do that!
@theracingforum Last year's trophy??? It helps when he keeps winning it!! And Lennox Lewis is improving his presentations!
Why doesn't that huntsman at Fakenham do something useful and catch the loose horse?
@CoopsRacing I think it should be earlier. 10-11am is just too close to racing, particularly in the winter.
@kenneth_hawkins @steeplechasing @HAYDOCKRACES Which I would have thought worthy of noting in the meeting Stewards Report!
@steeplechasing I have asked @HAYDOCKRACES how they arrived at the result
@HAYDOCKRACES Dare I ask how the placings were determined for the 3.15? Shouldn't there have been some sort of Stewards Report on the farce?
@steeplechasing and, given that no distances were returned, one wonders if they just asked the jockeys where they finished?
@HAYDOCKRACES Stewards Report for 3.15 reads 'Nothing to Report'. Presumably because they couldn't see anything?
@steeplechasing presumably it would be a void race.
@steeplechasing Anyone playing in-running at Ascot or Haydock today wants carting away by 'the white coats'!
@RichardHoiles There are sometimes I envy you your job and sometimes I don't! It's the latter @Ascot today and very well done.
@HuntyCaller Remember from when I was down south, peering through the fog is part of tradition of this @Ascot meeting! Still a favourite!
DELUSIONOFGRANDEUR franked Aux Ptits Soins @KelsoRacecourse form very nicely @CatterickRaces today.
@PITLOCHRYft @Channel4Racing We did indeed. Scrooge was an absolute cracker of a musical.
Would be nice if the Turkish Cross Country team had the odd Turkish runner...
@shugiehughie Looks like a a literal view of that given Walking In The Air's mark. Handicap marks based on big margins are often dubious.
@shugiehughie 'never travelling after mistake at the fifth', reported finishing with a 'wound on his stifle'.
Great afternoon watching @Channel4Racing now off to @PITLOCHRYft for Scrooge The Musical!
Nice Time Trial by CLIFFS OF DOVER at Donny!
@Narrowthefield Agree. He's run a lot of races and would be going to chasing comparatively late, but still one of the best hurdlers around.
Cracking ride by Jack Sherwood on Present Man. Lesson in how to deal with wonky steering!
